input.name: __VIEWSTATE

span.strong: Click here to access the Special Board of Education Meeting starting at 7:00 p.m. tonight.

p.span: North Olmsted City Schools continues to monitor developments surrounding the coronavirus and the
confirmed cases in Cuyahoga County and Ohio. To date, there are no confirmed cases associated with North Olmsted City Schools.

On all health related matters, the district works closely with the Cuyahoga County Board of Health, the Ohio Department of Health and the United States Center for Disease Control and Prevention. We stay up to date on the information and resources provided by these agencies and also follow their recommendations and guidelines to ensure a healthy school community.

span.strong: The district will still have spring break as scheduled April 10 - April19.

span.div: The COVID-19 pandemic continues to have a huge impact across the State of Ohio and our North Olmsted community. We would like to provide some important information that will impact this school year as well as next school year.

div.span: The school closure has also prompted several questions about upcoming school events, more specifically, prom and graduation. At this time, the district has decided to reschedule both prom and graduation for a later date in June.
Students and staff will begin Spring break on this Friday
. There will be no Online/eLearning during spring break.

b.i: Online/eLearning will resume on Monday, April 20, 2020 and 4th Quarter will begin.

img.title: lunch image
img.a: School Meal Pickup Locations and Food Resources (UPDATED April 8)

div.span: There will be no grab and go meal distribution this Friday, April 10 due to the Good Friday holiday. Meals distributed on Thursday will include two days of food. Grab and go meals will resume on Monday April 13

span.style: background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial

div.span: In conjunction with the school closure, several events have been cancelled through spring break. Here is a full list of cancellations. Please check back often as additional events could be added to the list.

img.title: logo image
img.a: Message to Families About Google Meet

span.div: As we updated you earlier this week, we know schools will remain closed through Friday, May 1. We appreciate all you are doing to support your child in their learning.We wanted to provide you an update on a technology tool the district will be using so teachers can connect with students.

img.title: self connected image
img.a: Self Care Tips, Resources, and Suggestions

span.div: We know this can be a challenging time in many different ways. Attached are suggestions and tips for students, parents and staff members to help take care of yourself during this time. This information will be updated each week.

img.title: logo icon
img.a: District Statement School Closure EXTENDED March 30, 2020

p.span: Today, Governor Mike DeWine ordered an extension to the school closures in Ohio. Under this order schools will be closed until at least May 1, 2020.
The extended closure will also pertain to all school events including all athletic and extracurricular practices and competitions, as well as all weekend events.

img.title: question mark
img.a: Frequently Asked Questions - Online/eLearning and Grades

div.span: We know there are a lot of questions regarding grading periods, grades, and report cards. We have posted a Frequently Asked Questions document on the district website with answers to many of the common questions.

img.title: logo image
img.a: Virtual Spirit Day and Shout Out Signs!

br.span:
Print out a sign attached and take a photo in your North Olmsted spirit wear! Photos can be emailed to Amy.Rutledge@nocseagles.org.
Submitted photos will appear on the district Facebook and Twitter pages @NOCSEagles and might also appear on the district homepage!

span.div: Various companies are offering free internet for households during this school closure. Attached is information about those companies.

p.style: background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial
p.span: The outbreak of COVID-19 may be stressful for people. Fear and anxiety about a disease can be overwhelming and cause strong emotions in adults. Coping with stress will make you, the people you care about

img.title: computer icon
img.a: Need to Borrow a Chromebook? UPDATED

div.span: The Chromebook Request Form closed at 8:00 a.m. on Monday, March 23.For the safety of our staff and families, requests for at-home Chromebooks have been suspended at this time. We will inform our families if additional opportunities become available in the future.

span.div: Attached are a variety of resources parents can use to support the social and emotional health of children, teens and young adults during COVID-19.
Attached are a variety of community resources related to financial hardships.

img.title: phone icon
img.a: Emergency Numbers and Mental Health Hotlines

span.div: Attached are a variety of emergency numbers in case of a mental health crisis.

We would like to provide additional details regarding the school closure. This is a very unique situation and we appreciate your understanding and support as we navigate the challenges that COVID-19 has presented to our school community.

br.span:
Today, Governor Mike DeWine issued an order that all school districts in the State of Ohio are closed for a period of three weeks.
To comply with the order, North Olmsted City Schools will be closed starting tomorrow, March 13, 2020 through Friday, April 3, 2020.

span.div: The health and safety of our students remains a primary concern. As new information becomes available about the coronavirus, we work to update our emergency response plans and increase preventative safety measures.As a proactive step, the district will be closed on March 17, 2020 for all students.

The news of coronavirus COVID-19 continues to be a major headline in the United States and across the world. Questions and concerns have surfaced about the potential impact the coronavirus could have in the United States and our local community. As a district our students health and safety is a top priority. We would like to take this time to be proactive and provide you with some information and resources.

em.span: The Ohio Department of Health has established a call center to answer any questions related to the coronavirus. The call center is available from 9:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. seven days a week and can be reached at 1-833-4ASKODH (1-833-427-5634).
